item.title: Caitlín add a quote by Radiohead
item.description: "There's always a siren, singing you to shipwreck." -- Radiohead

item.title: Caitlín add a quote by Mark Z. Danielewski
item.description: "This is not for you." -- Mark Z. Danielewski

item.title: Caitlín add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "We couldn't understand because we were too far... and could not remember because we were traveling in the night of first ages, those ages that had gone, leaving hardly a sign... and no memories." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Caitlín add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "The carpenter's daughter has won a name for herself, and deserved to win it" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Caitlín add a quote by Jack Horner
item.description: "The worse the country, the more tortured it is by water and wind, the more broken and carved, the more it attracts fossil hunters, who depend on the planet to open itself to us. We can only scratch away at what natural forces have brought to the surface." -- Jack Horner

item.title: Caitlín add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "But just in proportion as this process of extermination has acted on an enormous scale, so must the number of intermediate varieties, which have formerly existed, be truly enormous. Why then is not every geological formation and every stratum full of such intermediate links? Geology assuredly does not reveal any such finely graduated organic chain; and this, perhaps, is the most obvious and serious objection which can be urged against the theory. The explanation lies, as I believe, in the extreme imperfection of the geological record." -- Charles Darwin
